Package linalg

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
linalg.Matrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixComparisons, MatrixManipulations, MatrixOperations, MatrixProperties
Direct Known Subclasses:
Vector
public class Matrix extends Object implements MatrixOperations, MatrixManipulations, MatrixProperties, MatrixComparisons
Provides several methods for construction, manipulations, operations, and comparisons of complex or real matrices. All matrices, even those constructed with int[][] or double[][] will have entries of the type CNumber
Author:
Jacob Watters

    • identity

      public static Matrix identity​(int size)
      Generates the identity matrix of a specified size. Same as I(int size) The identity matrix is a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal. All other entries are zero. The Identity matrix is the multiplicative identity for matrices. That is, given a matrix B and the appropriately sized identity matrix, B*I=B.
      Parameters:
      size - - size of identity matrix. For example, if size = 3, then the 3x3 identity matrix will be returned.
      Returns:
      Identity matrix of specified size.

    • I

      public static Matrix I​(int size)
      Generates the identity matrix of a specified size. Same as identity(int size) The identity matrix is a square matrix with ones on the main diagonal. All other entries are zero. The Identity matrix is the multiplicative identity for matrices. That is, given a matrix B and the appropriately sized identity matrix, B*I=B.
      Parameters:
      size - - size of identity matrix. For example, if size = 3, then the 3x3 identity matrix will be returned.
      Returns:
      Identity matrix of specified size.

    • I

      public static Matrix I​(int m, int n)
      Creates an identity like matrix rectangular. That is, a matrix of zeros with ones along the principle diagonal.
      Parameters:
      m - - Number of rows in matrix.
      n - - Number of columns in matrix.
      Returns:
      - Identity-like matrix of specified size.

    • random

      public static Matrix random​(String shape, double min, double max, boolean... magnitude_flag)
      Constructs matrix of given size with random numbers between min and max. If the boolean flag is true than min and max are used as min and max of complex magnitude. Otherwise, min and max are used as min and max values of real numbers.
      Parameters:
      shape - - Shape of the resulting matrix.
      min - - Lower bound for random number
      max - - Upper bound for random number
      magnitude_flag - - Optional flag to use min and max as bounds for magnitude of complex number.
      Returns:
      Matrix with random entries of specified size

    • random

      public static Matrix random​(int rows, int cols, double min, double max, boolean... magnitude_flag)
      Constructs matrix of given size with random numbers between min and max. If the boolean flag is true than min and max are used as min and max of complex magnitude. Otherwise, min and max are used as min and max values of real numbers.
      Parameters:
      rows - - Number of rows in resulting matrix
      cols - - Number of columns in resulting matrix
      min - - Lower bound for random number
      max - - Upper bound for random number
      magnitude_flag - - Optional flag to use min and max as bounds for magnitude of complex number.
      Returns:
      Matrix with random entries of specified size

    • random

      public static Matrix random​(String shape, boolean... magnitude_flag)
      Constructs matrix of given size with random numbers between zero and one. If the boolean flag is true than min and max are used as min and max of complex magnitude. Otherwise, min and max are used as min and max values of real numbers.
      Parameters:
      shape - - Shape of the resulting matrix.
      magnitude_flag - - Optional flag to generate complex number with magnitude between zero and one.
      Returns:
      Matrix of specified size with random entries.

    • random

      public static Matrix random​(int rows, int cols, boolean... magnitude_flag)
      Constructs matrix of given size with random numbers between zero and one. If the boolean flag is true than min and max are used as min and max of complex magnitude. Otherwise, min and max are used as min and max values of real numbers.
      Parameters:
      rows - - Number of rows in resulting matrix.
      cols - - Number of columns in resulting matrix.
      magnitude_flag - - Optional flag to generate complex number with magnitude between zero and one.
      Returns:
      Matrix of specified size with random entries.

    • randn

      public static Matrix randn​(int rows, int cols, boolean complex)
      Generates a matrix of given size where all entries are normaly distributed random values with mean of zero and a standard deviation of one.
      Parameters:
      rows - - Number of rows in resulting matrix.
      cols - - Number of columns in resulting matrix.
      mag - - flag to generate complex number.
      Returns:
      Matrix of specified size with random entries.

      Returns:

    • randomOrthogonal

      public static Matrix randomOrthogonal​(int n)
      Generates a random orthogonal matrix distributed with Haar measure. A matrix B is orthogonal if and only if BTB = I.
      Parameters:
      n - - Size of the random orthogonal matrix.
      Returns:
      A random orthogonal matrix.

    • randomUinitary

      public static Matrix randomUinitary​(int n)
      Generates a random orthogonal matrix distributed with Haar measure. A matrix B is orthogonal if and only if B*B = I.
      Parameters:
      n - - Size of the random orthogonal matrix.
      Returns:
      A random orthogonal matrix.

      public double[][] getValuesAsDouble()
      Gets values from matrix converted to doubles.
